On Thu, Jan 14, 2010 at 10:40 AM, Andrew Wahbe <andrew.wahbe@...>wrote:

>
> Yup... if you are using a "standard" media type in a "non-standard" way
> then you will forfeit interoperability. And this is where lots of folks are
> going wrong with Atom -- using it to do something other than publish and
> syndicate content. Sure you can introduce extensions to extend what a media
> type can do, but if those extensions are "service-specific" then you won't
> get general interoperability or client-service decoupling.
>
>
Yeah, I agree with this which is way I'm never satisfied with the generic
recommendation to use current media types (apart from existing tooling
benefits, which is not really the point here) during design.

--000e0cd1b4ee8614e2047d2312d3
